meanings.sent1: The color of the walls is immaterial to the success of the project.
meanings.sent2: In this discussion, your personal preferences are immaterial.
meanings.sent3: Whether you wear a hat or not is immaterial to the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were as immaterial as the wind blowing through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The size of the gift was immaterial compared to the thought behind it.

meanings.sent1: She found peace in the immaterial realm of meditation.
meanings.sent2: The immaterial connection between them transcended physical distance.
meanings.sent3: His love for her was so strong, it felt almost immaterial.
meanings.sent4: Their bond was as immaterial as the whispers of the wind.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset painted an immaterial picture in her mind.

meanings.sent1: The ghostly figure appeared immaterial, like a mist in the night.
meanings.sent2: The dream felt so real yet entirely immaterial upon waking.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made the coin seem immaterial in his hands.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts drifted through the immaterial space of imagination.
meanings.sent5: The music created an immaterial atmosphere that enveloped the room.
